tool.name: optimizeRaster

param.name: opInRaster
param.dialogReference: The raster that the tool will perform adjustments against. Adjustments will either be calculating no data to a another value or removing cells with a value of 0.
param.pythonReference: The raster that the tool will perform adjustments against. Adjustments will either be calculating no data to a another value or removing cells with a value of 0.

param.name: opprocessname
param.dialogReference:
Two processes are available: Filling Gaps and Remove Extraneous Zeroes. The processes perform opposite functions and are based on raster processing if-then-else concepts.

  • Filling Gaps: Fills in NoData values with either a constant or cell values from another raster.

  • Remove Extraneous Zeroes: Changes values of 0 to a constant value or to values provided by another raster.
param.pythonReference:
Two processes are available: Filling Gaps and Remove Extraneous Zeroes. The processes perform opposite functions and are based on raster processing if-then-else concepts.

  • Filling Gaps: Fills in NoData values with either a constant or cell values from another raster.

  • Remove Extraneous Zeroes: Changes values of 0 to a constant value or to values provided by another raster.

param.name: opOutRaster
param.dialogReference: Path and name of the output raster. Specify the output extension as .tif.
param.pythonReference: Path and name of the output raster. Specify the output extension as .tif.

param.name: opinTrueRaster
param.displayname: Input True Raster or a numeric constant
param.dialogReference: An input integer, floating point raster or constant whose values will be written to the output raster if the input condition evaluates to true. The input condition depends upon the process name. If you specify Filling Gapsfor process name, the input condition checks for no data cells. If no data cells are found, the input constant value or the true raster cell value at the location of a no data cell will be written to the output raster. If you specify Remove Extraneous Zeroes for process name, the input condition checks for 0 values within cells in the input raster. You cannot specify a constant value or true raster if you choose Remove Extraneous Zeroes.
param.pythonReference: An input integer, floating point raster or constant whose values will be written to the output raster if the input condition evaluates to true. The input condition depends upon the process name. If you specify Filling Gapsfor process name, the input condition checks for no data cells. If no data cells are found, the input constant value or the true raster cell value at the location of a no data cell will be written to the output raster. If you specify Remove Extraneous Zeroes for process name, the input condition checks for 0 values within cells in the input raster. You cannot specify a constant value or true raster if you choose Remove Extraneous Zeroes.

param.name: opinFalseRaster
param.dialogReference: An input integer, floating point raster or constant whose values will be written to the output raster if the input condition evaluates to false. The input condition depends upon the process name. If you specify Filling Gaps for process name, the input condition checks for no data cells. For cells with values, the input constant value or the false raster cell value at the location of a cell will be written to the output raster. If you specify Remove Extraneous Zeroesfor process name, the input condition checks for cell values that are not 0. All cell values that are not 0 are calculated to no data. All cell values that are 0 are calculated to the constant value or false raster cell value.
param.pythonReference: An input integer, floating point raster or constant whose values will be written to the output raster if the input condition evaluates to false. The input condition depends upon the process name. If you specify Filling Gaps for process name, the input condition checks for no data cells. For cells with values, the input constant value or the false raster cell value at the location of a cell will be written to the output raster. If you specify Remove Extraneous Zeroesfor process name, the input condition checks for cell values that are not 0. All cell values that are not 0 are calculated to no data. All cell values that are 0 are calculated to the constant value or false raster cell value.

param.name: outputextent
param.dialogReference: Extent of output raster. Can be used to limit processing to a specified area.
param.pythonReference: Extent of output raster. Can be used to limit processing to a specified area.

param.name: opexpression
param.dialogReference:
A logical expression that determines which of the input cells are to be true or false.

The expression that you can apply depends upon the process name. See the following links for more information:

  • http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/main/10.2/#/Con/009z00000005000000/

  • http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/main/10.2/#/Set_Null/009z00000007000000/
param.pythonReference:
A logical expression that determines which of the input cells are to be true or false.

The expression that you can apply depends upon the process name. See the following links for more information:

  • http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/main/10.2/#/Con/009z00000005000000/

  • http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/main/10.2/#/Set_Null/009z00000007000000/

tool.summary: Performs common raster adjustments of assigning a value to NoData cells or removing cells with a value of zero. You are not required to run this tool for use in producing a weighted overlay service.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Performs common raster adjustments of assigning a value to NoData cells or removing cells with a value of zero. You are not required to run this tool for use in producing a weighted overlay service.
